docs.title: FastAPI Tags
docs.text: Adds s-expression HTML tags to FastAPI views. Inspired by FastHTML's use of fastcore's FT components.

docs.title: Installation:
docs.text:
uv:

uv add fastapi-tags

pip:

pip install fastapi-tags
uv pip install fastapi-tags

docs.title: Usage:
docs.text:
from fastapi import FastAPI
import fastapi_tags as tg

app = FastAPI()

@app.get("/", response_class=tg.TagResponse)
async def index():
    return tg.Html(tg.H1("Hello, world!", style="color: blue;"))

If you want to do snippets, just skip the tg.Html tag:

@app.get("/time", response_class=tg.TagResponse)
async def time():
    return tg.P("Time to do code!")

docs.title: With HTMX
docs.text:
If you want to detect HTMX use dependency injection:

from fastapi import Depends

@app.get("/hello", response_class=tg.TagResponse)
def test_endpoint(is_htmx: bool = Depends(tg.is_htmx_request)):
    if is_htmx:
        return tg.H1("Hello, hx-request! Here's a partial of the page.")
    else:
        return tg.Html(tg.H1("Hello normal request, Here's the full page!"))

docs.title: Custom Tags
docs.text: There are several ways to create custom Tags

docs.title: Subclassing
docs.text:
class AwesomeP(tg.P) -> tg.Tag:
    def render(self) -> str:
        return f"<p{self.attrs}>AWESOME {self.children}!</p>"
AwesomeP('library')

<p>AWESOME library!</p>

docs.title: Custom tags built as functions
docs.text:
def PicoCard(header: str, body: str, footer: str) -> tg.Tag:
    return tg.Article(
        tg.Header(header),
        body,
        tg.Footer(footer)
    )

@app.get("/card", response_class=tg.TagResponse)
async def card():
    return PicoCard(
        'FastAPI Tags',
        'Adds s-expression HTML tags (Tags) to FastAPI views.',
        'by various contributors'
    )

<article>
    <header>FastAPI Tags</header>
    Adds s-expression HTML tags (Tags) to FastAPI views.
    <footer>by various contributors</footer>
</article>

docs.title: Raw HTML Content
docs.text:
For cases where you need to render raw HTML:

from fastapi_tags import RawHTML

# Render raw HTML content
raw_content = RawHTML('<strong>Bold text</strong> and <em>italic</em>')

# Note: RawHTML only accepts a single string argument
# For multiple elements, combine them first:
html_string = '<p>First</p><p>Second</p>'
raw = RawHTML(html_string)

docs.title: Core Components
docs.text: This module contains the core functionality for FastAPI-Tags.

docs.title: TagResponse
docs.text:
Bases: Response

Custom response class to handle fastapi_tags.tags.Tags.

Source code in fastapi_tags/core.py 
class TagResponse(Response):
    """Custom response class to handle fastapi_tags.tags.Tags."""

    media_type = "text/html; charset=utf-8"

    def render(self, content: Any) -> bytes:
        """Render Tag elements to bytes of HTML."""
        if isinstance(content, dict):
            content = dict_to_ft_component(content)
        return content.render().encode("utf-8")

docs.title: render(content)
docs.text:
Render Tag elements to bytes of HTML.

Source code in fastapi_tags/core.py 
def render(self, content: Any) -> bytes:
    """Render Tag elements to bytes of HTML."""
    if isinstance(content, dict):
        content = dict_to_ft_component(content)
    return content.render().encode("utf-8")

docs.title: dict_to_ft_component(d)
docs.text:
Source code in fastapi_tags/core.py 
def dict_to_ft_component(d):
    children_raw = d.get("_children", ())
    children = tuple(
        dict_to_ft_component(c) if isinstance(c, dict) else c for c in children_raw
    )
    module = importlib.import_module(d["_module"])
    obj = getattr(module, d["_name"])
    return obj(*children, **d.get("_attrs", {}))

docs.title: is_htmx_request(hx_request=Header(default=None))
docs.text:
Source code in fastapi_tags/core.py 
def is_htmx_request(hx_request: str = Header(default=None)) -> bool:
    return hx_request is not None and hx_request.lower() == "true"

docs.title: CaseTag
docs.text:
Bases: Tag

This is for case-sensitive tags like those used in SVG generation.

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
class CaseTag(Tag):
    """This is for case-sensitive tags like those used in SVG generation."""

    @property
    def name(self) -> str:
        return self._name[0].lower() + self._name[1:]

docs.title: Html
docs.text:
Bases: Tag

Defines the root of an HTML document

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
class Html(Tag):
    """Defines the root of an HTML document"""

    def __init__(self, *children, headers: tuple | None = (), **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*children, **kwargs)
        self._headers = headers

    @property
    def headers(self):
        return "".join([c.render() if isinstance(c, Tag) else c for c in self._headers])

    def render(self) -> str:
        return f"""<!doctype html><html{self.attrs}><head>{self.headers}</head><body>{self.children}</body></html>"""

docs.title: __init__(*children, headers=(), **kwargs)
docs.text:
Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
def __init__(self, *children, headers: tuple | None = (), **kwargs):
    super().__init__(*children, **kwargs)
    self._headers = headers

docs.title: render()
docs.text:
Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
def render(self) -> str:
    return f"""<!doctype html><html{self.attrs}><head>{self.headers}</head><body>{self.children}</body></html>"""

docs.title: Htmx
docs.text:
Bases: Html

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
class Htmx(Html):
    def __init__(self, *children, headers: tuple | None = (), **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*children, **kwargs)
        self._headers = (
            Script(src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/htmx.org@2.0.5/dist/htmx.min.js"),
        ) + headers  # type: ignore[operator]

docs.title: __init__(*children, headers=(), **kwargs)

def __init__(self, *children, headers: tuple | None = (), **kwargs):
    super().__init__(*children, **kwargs)
    self._headers = (
        Script(src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/htmx.org@2.0.5/dist/htmx.min.js"),
    ) + headers  # type: ignore[operator]

docs.title: RawHTML
docs.text:
Bases: Tag

Custom tag for rendering raw HTML content without escaping.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default html_string

A single string containing raw HTML to render

required

Raises:

Type Description TypeError

If non-string content is provided

ValueError

If multiple arguments are provided

Example

RawHTML('Bold text') 'Bold text'

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
class RawHTML(Tag):
    """Custom tag for rendering raw HTML content without escaping.

    Args:
        html_string: A single string containing raw HTML to render

    Raises:
        TypeError: If non-string content is provided
        ValueError: If multiple arguments are provided

    Example:
        >>> RawHTML('<strong>Bold</strong> text')
        '<strong>Bold</strong> text'

        >>> # Use with other tags
        >>> Div(
        ...     P("Safe content"),
        ...     RawHTML('<hr class="divider">'),
        ...     P("More safe content")
        ... )
    """

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Initialize RawHTML with a single string argument.

        Args:
            *args: Should be exactly one string argument
            **kwargs: Ignored (for consistency with Tag interface)
        """
        if len(args) > 1:
            raise ValueError("RawHTML accepts only one string argument")

        html_string = args[0] if args else ""

        if not isinstance(html_string, str):
            raise TypeError("RawHTML only accepts string content")

        super().__init__(html_string)

    def render(self) -> str:
        """Render the raw HTML string without escaping."""
        return self._children[0] if self._children else ""

docs.title: Use with other tags
docs.text: Div( ... P("Safe content"), ... RawHTML(''), ... P("More safe content") ... )

def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
    """Initialize RawHTML with a single string argument.

    Args:
        *args: Should be exactly one string argument
        **kwargs: Ignored (for consistency with Tag interface)
    """
    if len(args) > 1:
        raise ValueError("RawHTML accepts only one string argument")

    html_string = args[0] if args else ""

    if not isinstance(html_string, str):
        raise TypeError("RawHTML only accepts string content")

    super().__init__(html_string)

Render the raw HTML string without escaping.

    return self._children[0] if self._children else ""

docs.title: Tag
__init__(*children, **kwargs)
docs.text:
Sets four attributes, name, module, children, and attrs. These are important for Starlette view responses, as nested objects get auto-serialized to JSON and need to be rebuilt. Without the values of these attributes, the object reconstruction can't occur

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
def __init__(self, *children, **kwargs):
    """Sets four attributes, name, module, children, and attrs.
    These are important for Starlette view responses, as nested objects
    get auto-serialized to JSON and need to be rebuilt. Without
    the values of these attributes, the object reconstruction can't occur"""
    self._name = self.__class__.__name__
    self._module = self.__class__.__module__
    self._children, self._attrs = children, kwargs

docs.title: render()
docs.text:
Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
def render(self) -> str:
    return f"<{self.name}{self.attrs}>{self.children}</{self.name}>"

docs.title: attrmap(o)
docs.text:
Converts shims for class and for such as _class, cls, _for, fr into their HTML implementations

Source code in fastapi_tags/tags.py 
def attrmap(o):
    """Converts shims for class and for such as _class, cls, _for, fr into
    their HTML implementations
    """
    # This function originated in fastcore.
    if _specials & set(o):
        return o
    o = dict(
        htmlClass="class",
        cls="class",
        _class="class",
        klass="class",
        _for="for",
        fr="for",
        htmlFor="for",
    ).get(o, o)
    return _fix_k(o)
